tp.pr3.instructions

Class QuitInstruction

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr3.instructions.QuitInstruction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Instruction

    public class QuitInstruction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Instruction
    Its execution request the robot to finish the simulation This Instruction works if the user writes QUIT or SALIR

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuitInstruction()
      It builds a default QuitInstruction

      • parse

        public Instruction parse(java.lang.String cad)
                  throws WrongInstructionFormatException
        Parsers the String returning an instance of QuitInstruction or throwing a WrongInstructionFormatException()
        Specified by:

        cad - text String to parse
        Returns:
        Instruction reference to an instance of QuitInstruction

        WrongInstructionFormatException - When the String is not QUIT | SALIR

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws InstructionExecutionException
        Request the robot to stop the simulation
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Instruction
        Throws:

      • getHelp

        public java.lang.String getHelp()
        Description copied from interface: Instruction
        Returns a description of the Instruction syntax. The string does not end with the line separator. It is up to the caller adding it before printing.
        Specified by:
        getHelp in interface Instruction
        Returns:
        the Instruction syntax QUIT|SALIR

      • configureContext

        public void configureContext(RobotEngine engine,
                    NavigationModule navigation,
                    ItemContainer robotContainer)
        Description copied from interface: Instruction
        Set the execution context. The method receives the entire engine (engine, navigation and the robot container) even though the actual implementation of execute() may not require it.
        Specified by:
        configureContext in interface Instruction
        Parameters:
        engine - The robot engine
        navigation - The information about the game, i.e., the places, current direction and current heading to navigate
        robotContainer - The inventory of the robot
